panels.description: Total number of CPU cores
panels.title: CPU Cores

panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together
panels.title: CPU Busy

panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together (5 min average)
panels.title: Sys Load (5m avg)

panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together (15 min average)
panels.title: Sys Load (15m avg)

panels.description:
Perentage of time CPUs spent in each mode.

System: Processes executing in kernel mode.

User: Normal processes executing in user mode.

Nice: Niced processes executing in user mode.

Idle: Waiting for something to happen.

Iowait: Waiting for I/O to complete.

Irq: Servicing interrupts.

Softirq: Servicing softirqs.

Steal: Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment.

Guest: Time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system.

Other: Other.

matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen

panels.title: CPU time utilization

panels.description: Total RAM
panels.title: RAM Total

panels.description: Non available RAM memory
panels.title: RAM Used

panels.description: Total SWAP
panels.title: SWAP Total

panels.description: Used Swap
panels.title: SWAP Used

panels.description:
Memory utilization.

RAM total: Total memory in bytes.

RAM used: Memory usage in bytes.

RAM Cache + Buffer: Memory cache and Buffer usage in bytes.

RAM free: Free memory space in bytes.

SWAP used: Swap usage in bytes.

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Memory utilization

panels.description:
Apps: Memory used by user-space applications.

Page tables: Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses.

Swap cache: Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified.

Slab: Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc).

Cache: Parked file data (file content) cache.

Buffers: Block device (e.g. harddisk) cache.

Unused: Free memory unassigned.

Swap: Swap space used.

Hardware corrupted: Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working.

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Memory Stack

panels.description:
Inactive: Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes.

Active: Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary.

Inactive file: File-backed memory on inactive LRU list.

Inactive anonymous: Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem).

Active file: File-backed memory on active LRU list.

Active anonymous: Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs.

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Memory Active / Inactive Detail

panels.description:
Mapped: Used memory in mapped pages files which have been mmaped, such as libraries.

Shared: Used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks).

Shared huge pages: Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs allocated  with huge pages.

Shared pmd mapped: Amount of shared (shmem/tmpfs) memory backed by huge pages.

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
ShmemHugePages - Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs allocated  with huge pages
ShmemHugePages - Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs allocated  with huge pages

panels.title: Memory Shared and Mapped

panels.description:
Committed allocated system: Amount of memory presently allocated on the system.

Commited limit: Amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Memory Commited

panels.description: Huge pages size: Huge pages size.
panels.title: Huge pages size

panels.description:
Free huge pages: Huge pages in the pool.

Reserved huge pages: Huge pages (commitment to allocate has been made, but no allocation yet).

Huge pages surplus: Huge pages in the pool above the value in proc/sys/vm/nr_hugepages.

Total  huge pages: Total size of the pool of huge pages.
panels.title: Memory Huge Pages

panels.description:
Pages in: Page in operations.

Pages out: Page out operations.
panels.title: Memory Pages In / Out

panels.description:
Pages swap in: Pages swapped in.

Pages swap out: Pages swapped out.
panels.title: Memory Pages Swap In / Out

panels.description:
Page fault: Page major and minor fault operations.

Page major fault: Major page fault operations.

Page minor fault: Minor page fault operations.

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations

panels.title: Memory Page faults

panels.description:
Anonymous huge pages: Memory in anonymous huge pages.

Anonymous pages: Memory in user pages not backed by files.
panels.title: Memory Anonymous

panels.description:
Vmalloc chunk: Largest contigious block of vmalloc area which is free.

Vmalloc total: Total size of vmalloc memory area.

Vmalloc used: Amount of vmalloc area which is used.
panels.title: Memory Vmalloc

panels.description:
Writeback: Memory which is actively being written back to disk.

Writeback temporary: Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers.

Dirty: Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk.
panels.title: Memory Writeback and Dirty

panels.description:
DirectMap1G: Amount of pages mapped as this size.

DirectMap2M: Amount of pages mapped as this size.

DirectMap4K: Amount of pages mapped as this size.
panels.title: Memory Direct Mapping

panels.description: NFS unstable: Memory in NFS pages sent to the server, but not yet commited to the storage.
panels.title: Memory NFS

panels.description: Bounce: Memory used for block device bounce buffers.

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Memory bounce

panels.description:
Unreclaim: Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure.

Reclaimable: Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches.
panels.title: Memory slab

panels.description:
Kernel stack: Kernel memory stack. This is not reclaimable.

Per CPU: Per CPU memory allocated dynamically by loadable modules.

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Memory Kernel / CPU

panels.description:
Unevictable: Amount of unevictable memory that can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons.

MLocked: Size of pages locked to memory using the mlock() system call.

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Memory Unevictable and MLocked

panels.description: OOM killer invocations.
panels.title: OOM Killer

panels.description: Disk space utilization.
panels.title: Disk space used (GB)

panels.description: Disk space utilization percentage of all filesystems mounted.
panels.title: Disk space used (%)

panels.description:
Reads completed: The total number of reads completed successfully.

Writes completed: The total number of writes completed successfully.
panels.title: Disk IOps

panels.description: Time spent: Total seconds spent doing I/Os.
panels.title: I/O Utilization

panels.description:
Successfully read: The total number of bytes read successfully.

Successfully written: The total number of bytes written successfully.
panels.title: I/O Usage Read / Write

panels.description: Percentage of elapsed time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100% for devices serving requests serially.  But for devices  serving requests in parallel, such as RAID arrays and modern SSDs, this number does not reflect their performance limits.
panels.title: I/Os time utilization

panels.description: The number (after merges) of I/O requests completed per second for the device.
panels.title: Disk IOps Completed

panels.description:
Read bytes: The number of bytes read from the device per second.

Written bytes: The number of bytes written to the device per second.
panels.title: Disk R/W Data

panels.description:
The number of read and write requests merged per second that were queued to the device.

Read merged: The total number of reads merged.

Write merged: The total number of writes merged.
panels.title: Disk R/W Merged

panels.description:
Discards completed: The total number of discards completed successfully.

Discards completed: The total number of discards merged.
panels.title: Disk IOps Discards completed / merged

panels.description: The total number of seconds spent by all discards.
panels.title: Disk discard time utilization

panels.description: The total number of sectors discarded successfully.
panels.title: Discarded sectors

panels.description:
The average time for requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.

Read time: The total number of seconds spent by all reads.

Wait time: Total number of seconds spent by all writes.
panels.title: Disk Average Wait Time

panels.description:
The average queue length of the requests that were issued to the device.

Weighted: The weighted number of seconds spent doing I/Os.
panels.title: Average Queue Size

panels.description:
The number of outstanding requests at the instant the sample was taken. Incremented as requests are given to appropriate struct request_queue and decremented as they finish.

I/O now: The number of I/Os currently in progress.
panels.title: Instantaneous Queue Size

panels.description: Filesystem size in bytes.
panels.title: RootFS total

panels.description: Used Root FS.
panels.title: Root FS used

panels.description: Filesystem space available to non-root users in bytes.
panels.title: Filesystem space available

panels.description:
Maximum open file descriptors: Maximum number of open file descriptors.

Open filedesriptors: Number of open file descriptors.
panels.title: File Descriptors

panels.description:
Free file nodes: Filesystem total free file nodes.

File nodes size: Filesystem total file nodes.
panels.title: File nodes

panels.description:
Read only: Filesystem read-only status.

Device error: Whether an error occurred while getting statistics for the given device.
panels.title: Filesystem in ReadOnly / Error

panels.description: Apt package pending updates by origin.
panels.title: Pending Apt package updates

panels.description: Duration of a collector scrape by collector.
panels.title: Node Exporter Scrape Time

panels.description:
Scrape success: Boolean value of status that indicates whether a collector succeeded.

Scrape textfile: The result is equal to 1 if there was an error opening or reading a file, 0 otherwise.
panels.title: Node Exporter Scrape (boolean)

panels.description:
Estimated: Estimated errors in seconds.

Offset: Time offset in between local system and reference clock.

Maximum error: Maximum error in seconds.
panels.title: Time syncronized drift

panels.description:
Synchronized: Is clock synchronized to a reliable server (1 = yes, 0 = no).

Adjustment: Local clock frequency adjustment.
panels.title: Time syncronized status

panels.description: Adjustment: Local clock frequency adjustment.
panels.title: Time PLL adjust

panels.description:
Ticks: Seconds between clock ticks.

International Atomic Time (TAI): International Atomic Time (TAI) Offset.
panels.title: Time Misc

panels.description:
Blocked: Processes blocked waiting for I/O to complete.

Runnable: Processes in runnable state.
panels.title: Processes status

panels.description: Processes forks seconds: Time of Processes forks per seconds.
panels.title: Processes forks

panels.description:
Processes size: Processes virtual memory size in bytes.

Resident memory: Resident memory size in bytes.

Maximum amount: Maximum amount of virtual memory available in bytes.
panels.title: Processes memory

panels.description:
Context switches: Total number of context switches.

Interrupts: Total number of interrupts serviced.
panels.title: Context switches / Interrupts

panels.description:
Load 1m: Load 1m average.

Load 5m: Load 5m average.

Load 15m: Load 15m average.
panels.title: System Load

panels.description: Seconds the CPUs spent in each mode.
panels.title: CPU time spent in user and system contexts

panels.description: Bits of available entropy.
panels.title: Entropy

panels.description:
Accepted connections: Total number of accepted socket connections by name.

Refused connections: Total number of refused socket connections by name.
panels.title: Systemd sockets

panels.description: Summary of systemd unit states.
panels.title: Systemd Units State

panels.description:
Receive: Number of received network bytes.

Transmit: Number of transmitted network bytes.
panels.title: Network Traffic

panels.description:
Receive: Number of received packets per second.

Transmit: Number of transmitted packets per second.
panels.title: Network Traffic by Packets

panels.description:
Receive drop: Packets Dropped on receive.

Transmit drop: Packets dropped on transmit.
panels.title: Network Traffic Drop

panels.description:
Receive errors: Errors in received network packets per second.

Transmit errors: Errors in transmitted network packets per second.
panels.title: Network traffic errors

panels.description: Receive multicast: Received multicast network packets per second.
panels.title: Network Traffic Multicast

panels.description:
Receive compressed: Compressed network received packets per second.

Transmit compressed: ompressed network transmitted packets per second.
panels.title: Network traffic compressed

panels.description: Receive frame: Received network packet frames per second.
panels.title: Network Traffic Frame

panels.description:
Receive fifo: Network fifo traffic received.

Transmit fifo: Network fifo traffic transmitted.
panels.title: Network Traffic Fifo

panels.description: Transmit colls: Number of Transmit colls.
panels.title: Network Traffic Colls

panels.description: Statistic transmit carrier.
panels.title: Network Traffic Carrier

panels.description: ARP entries by device.
panels.title: ARP Entries

panels.description:
NF conntrack entries: Number of currently allocated flow entries for connection tracking.

NF conntrack limit: Maximum size of connection tracking table.
panels.title: NF Contrack

panels.description: Speed bytes value of /sys/class/net/<iface>.
panels.title: Speed

panels.description: MTU bytes value of /sys/class/net/<iface>.
panels.title: MTU

panels.description:
Operational state: Value is 1 if operstate is 'up', 0 otherwise.

Physical link state: Carrier value of /sys/class/net/<iface>.
panels.title: Network Operational Status

panels.description: ransmit queue length value of /sys/class/net/<iface>.
panels.title: Queue Length

panels.description:
TCP allocated sockets: Number of TCP sockets in state alloc.

TCP in use sockets: Number of TCP sockets in state inuse.

TCP mem sockets: Number of TCP sockets in state mem.

TCP orphan sockets: Number of TCP sockets in state orphan.

TCP waiting close: Number of TCP sockets in state tw.
panels.title: Sockstat TCP

panels.description:
UDPLITE inuse sockets: Number of UDPLITE sockets in state inuse.

UDP inuse sockets: Number of UDP sockets in state inuse.

UDP mem sockets: Number of UDP sockets in state mem.
panels.title: Sockstat UDP

panels.description:
TCP mem sockets: Number of TCP sockets in state mem.

UDP mem sockets: Number of UDP sockets in state mem.

FRAG memory sockets: Number of FRAG sockets in state memory.
panels.title: Sockstat Memory Size

panels.description: Sockets in use.
panels.title: Sockstat used

panels.description: Number of FRAG sockets in state inuse.

targets.legendFormat: RAW inuse - Raw sockets currently in use

panels.title: Sockstat FRAG / RAW

panels.description:
Received octets: Received octets.
Transmitted octets: Transmitted octets.
panels.title: Netstat IP In / Out Octets

panels.description:
In messages: Messages which the entity received.

Out messages: Messages which this entity attempted to send.
panels.title: ICMP In / Out

panels.description:
In datagrams: Datagrams received.

Out datagrams: Datagrams sent.
panels.title: UDP In / Out

panels.description:
In segments: Segments received, including those received in error. This count includes segments received on currently established connections.

Out segments: Segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets.
panels.title: TCP In / Out

panels.description: Established: TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE- WAIT.
panels.title: TCP Connections

panels.description: IP forwarding.
panels.title: Netstat IP Forwarding

panels.description: InErrors: Messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.).
panels.title: ICMP Errors

panels.description:
In errors: UDP Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application.

No ports: UDP Datagrams received on a port with no listener.

In errors lite: UDPLite Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application.
panels.title: UDP Errors

panels.description:
Listen overflows: Times the listen queue of a socket overflowed.

Listen drops: SYNs to LISTEN sockets ignored.

SYN retransmitted: SYN-SYN/ACK retransmits to break down retransmissions in SYN, fast/timeout retransmits.

Retransmitted segments: Segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets.

In errors: Segments received in error (e.g., bad TCP checksums).

Out retransmitted: Segments sent with RST flag.
panels.title: TCP Errors

panels.description:
SYN cookies failed: Number of Invalid SYN cookies received.

SYN cookies received: Number of SYN cookies received.

SYN cookies sent: Number of SYN cookies sent.
panels.title: TCP SYN cookie

panels.description:
Active opens: TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state

Passive opens: TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state.
panels.title: TCP Direct Transition
